CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lois Bowe, medical technologist, Wilkinsburg and Miss Eileen Williams, recent graduate, Penn HIlls, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 7, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "Do you agree with the Supreme Court's decision against prayer in public schools?"  Mrs. Bowe's answer reads: "Our Constitution was based on God, and with God, there is prayer.  I think praying should be one of the first things we do in the morning, not only in school, but throughout our lives."  Ms. Williams' answer reads: "I don't see anything wrong with having prayer in school."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Lois Bowe wearing light colored shirt dress, standing in front of Thrift Drugs, Fifth Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Eileen Williams wearing light colored floral dress, standing in front of Thrift Drugs, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
